data.title: 1865 6 vols History of Friedrich II of Prussia called Frederick the Great
meta_keywords: 1859-1865 6 vols History of Friedrich II of Prussia called Frederick the Great
data.meta_description: 1859-1865 6 vols History of Friedrich II of Prussia called Frederick the Great
data.text:
Description

Folding Maps, Illustrated, Leather Binding

History of Frederick II. of Prussia, Called Frederick the Great is a biography of Frederick II by renowned Scottish essayist and historian Thomas Carlyle that was first published in six volumes from 1858-1865.

Frederick II was King in Prussia from 1740 until 1772 and King of Prussia from 1772 until his death in 1786.

The first and second volumes are copies of the third edition published in 1859. The third volume was published in 1862, the fourth in 1864 and the fifth and sixth in 1865. Within the six volume there are a total of twenty one books.

The first volume deals with Friedrich's birth and parentage, with a frontispiece and map.

The second volume deals with Friedrich's apprenticeship and time at Reinsberg, with two folding maps and a frontispiece.

The third volume considers the First Silesian War and has a frontispiece. Kimbolton congregational book society to front free endpaper, Colin inscription and another previous owner inscription.

The fourth volume considers the Second Silesian War and The Seven Years War and has a frontispiece. Kimbolton congregational book society to front free endpaper, Colin inscription and another previous owner inscription.

The fifth volume continues The Seven Years War, with six maps, three which are folding and a frontispiece. Kimbolton congregational book society to front free endpaper, Colin inscription and another previous owner inscription.

The sixth volume ends The Seven Years War and has four folding maps. Kimbolton congregational book society to front free endpaper, previous owner inscription.

Condition

All volumes are in half calf binding with cloth covered boards. Externally, generally smart with some marks to the spines and boards. Volumes one and two have previous owner pencil inscription to the page after front free endpaper. The other four volumes have a sheet for the Kimbolton congregational book society pasted to front free endpaper and the previous owner pencil inscription to the next page and another pen inscription. The folding map to the end of volume five is a little torn to the folds. Front hinge is starting on volume two and three but remain firm. All volume are firmly bound with generally bright pages which are generally clean with some scattered spots that are mainly concentrate to the first and last few pages.

Overall: Good
